qas.question: What forms of transport are available in the Congo?
When was the Congo's train system built?
What is a common destination outside of Africa for Congolese airlines?
On what ocean is a major port located?
What method of transport is not available in the Republic of the Congo?
When did the country's rail system get taken out of operation?
How many kilometers of unpaved roads are in the Congo?
How many domestic airports are located in the Republic of the Congo?
Which ocean does the Congo have no ports on?

context: Transport in the Republic of the Congo includes <a0_0>land, air and <b4_0>water<b4_0/><a0_0/> transportation. The country's rail system was built by forced laborers during the <a1_0><b5_0>1930s<b5_0/><a1_0/> and largely remains in operation. There are also over <b6_0>1000<b6_0/> km of paved roads and <b7_0>two<b7_0/> major international airports (Maya-Maya Airport and Pointe Noire Airport) which have flights to <a2_0>Paris<a2_0/> and many African cities. The country also has a large port on the <a3_0><b8_0>Atlantic<b8_0/> Ocean<a3_0/> at Pointe-Noire and others along the Congo River at Brazzaville and Impfondo.
